docs.snippet: MAR DEL-PLATA, Argentina, April 13 (AP) -- Bobby Fischer of Brooklyn moved into a first-place tie today in the international chess masters tournament.

headline.main: FISCHER IS VICTOR AND TIES FOR LEAD; Brooklynite Downs Alvarez in Argentine Chess -- Tal and Botvinnik Draw

docs.snippet: Boris Spassky of Russia, with a 12-1 record, has regained his lead over the United States champion, Bobby Fischer (11 1/2 -- 1 1/2), in the international masters' chess tournament at Mar del Plata, according to reports received yesterday from the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Boris Spassky of Russia, with a 12-1 record, has regained his lead over the United States champion, Bobby Fischer (11 1/2 -- 1 1/2), in the international masters' chess tournament at Mar del Plata, according to reports received yesterday from the Argentine.

headline.main: Spassky Gains Lead Over Fischer Again In Argentine Chess

docs.snippet: SOCCER -- the granddaddy of all football games -- comes as naturally as kicking pebbles does to a schoolboy. Soccer is that elemental and universally indigenous, even though its heroes are highly skilled in passing, dribbling and booting the round...
docs.lead_paragraph: SOCCER -- the granddaddy of all football games -- comes as naturally as kicking pebbles does to a schoolboy. Soccer is that elemental and universally indigenous, even though its heroes are highly skilled in passing, dribbling and booting the round ball and it was no trick at all for Caesar's legions to teach it to the English.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 15 -- The Inter-American Peace Committee of the Organization of American States appealed today for the release of political prisoners and of persons who have taken refuge in diplomatic missions.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 15 -- The Inter-American Peace Committee of the Organization of American States appealed today for the release of political prisoners and of persons who have taken refuge in diplomatic missions.

docs.snippet: Boris Spassky of Russia defeated Osvaldo Bazan of Argentina yesterday to maintain his half-point lead over Bobby Fischer of the United States in the masters' chess tournament at Mar del Plata, Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: Boris Spassky of Russia defeated Osvaldo Bazan of Argentina yesterday to maintain his half-point lead over Bobby Fischer of the United States in the masters' chess tournament at Mar del Plata, Argentina.

headline.main: Spassky, Fischer Are Victors Again In Masters' Chess

docs.snippet: THE results of a survey made by the Caribbean Tourist Association among summer visitors to the Caribbean last year showed that younger people form the bulk of the visitors. Eighty-two per cent of those interviewed were under 45 years old and more...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE results of a survey made by the Caribbean Tourist Association among summer visitors to the Caribbean last year showed that younger people form the bulk of the visitors. Eighty-two per cent of those interviewed were under 45 years old and more than half (55 per cent) were under 35.

headline.main: NEWS AND NOTES FROM THE FIELD OF TRAVEL
